title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Education Research: MTSS Implementation Outcomes Analysis
text:
This blog documents my final project of EDLD 652 Course: Data Visualization Winter 2026
I will be analysing how different tiers of support within the Muti-Tiered Systems of Support (MTSS) influence student improvement outcomes.
The research will specifically answer the following questions:
Research Questions and Potential Visualizations

Do small-group lessons (Tiers 2 & 3) help more than whole-class teaching (Tier 1)?
Which Tier(s) is more effective for minority students compare to non-minority
students?
Does student behavior improve more when teachers receive specialized training?

title: Education Research: MTSS Implementation Outcomes Analysis
section: Below you will find my latest progress reports and data visualizations.
text: Below you will find my latest progress reports and data visualizations.

title: MTSS Delivery Method Analysis
text:
The goal of this project is to analyze the effectiveness of different educational interventions. Specifically, I am examining how various delivery methods impact the Improvement Index of students.
This analysis focuses on the Multi-Tiered System of Supports (MTSS) framework, comparing two primary strategies:

Small-Group (Tiers 2 & 3): Targeted support for students who need more intensive help.
Whole-Class (Tier 1): Universal instruction provided to all students in a classroom.

By visualizing these differences, I aim to determine which delivery method consistently yields higher average student growth.

## Initial Project Visualization

#| label: fig-mtss
#| fig-cap: "Average Improvement Index by Delivery Method"
#| echo: true
#| warning: false

library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.6
✔ forcats   1.0.1     ✔ stringr   1.6.0
✔ ggplot2   4.0.1     ✔ tibble    3.3.0
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.1.0     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

# Ensure your CSV is in the 'data' folder of your project

df <- read_csv("Interventions_Studies_And_Findings_clean.csv")

Rows: 13280 Columns: 285
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (28): i_Intervention_Name, i_Protocol, i_Outcome_Domain, i_Intervention...
dbl (226): ReviewID, i_InterventionID, i_Protocol_Version, i_NumStudiesMeeti...
lgl  (31): i_Demographics_Sample_International, i_Ethnicity_Not_Hispanic, i_...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

# Calculate means 
mtss_data <- df %>% 
  summarise( 
    `Small-Group (Tiers 2 & 3)` = mean(f_Improvement_Index[s_Delivery_Method_Small_Group %in% 1], na.rm = TRUE), 
    `Whole-Class (Tier 1)` = mean(f_Improvement_Index[s_Delivery_Method_Whole_Class %in% 1], na.rm = TRUE) 
  ) %>% 
  pivot_longer(cols = everything(), names_to = "Method", values_to = "Avg_Improvement")

# Create the visualization
ggplot(mtss_data, aes(x = reorder(Method, Avg_Improvement), y = Avg_Improvement, fill = Method)) + 
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") + 
  geom_text(aes(label = round(Avg_Improvement, 2)), vjust = -0.5) + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  labs( 
    title = "Average Improvement Index by Delivery Method", 
    x = "Delivery Method", 
    y = "Average Improvement Index" 
  ) + 
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#1f77b4", "#ff7f0e")) + 
  theme(legend.position = "none")

The goal of this project is to analyze the effectiveness of different educational interventions. Specifically, I am examining how various delivery methods impact the Improvement Index of students.
This analysis focuses on the Multi-Tiered System of Supports (MTSS) framework, comparing two primary strategies:

By visualizing these differences, I aim to determine which delivery method consistently yields higher average student growth.
